metadata.Title: CVE-2022-0108 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Inappropriate implementation in Navigation in Google Chrome prior to 97.0.4692.71 allowed a remote attacker to leak cross-origin data via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0108` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.38.6-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.38.6-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.38.6-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.38.6-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.38.6-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.38.6-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.38.6-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> The Debian chromium source package is called chromium-browser in Ubuntu mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 19.10, the chromium-browser package is just a script that installs the Chromium snap

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.38.6-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
wpewebkit package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
